data.title: Toronto Festival: Films Making Waves With Buyers
data.meta_description: Toronto Film Festival: Titles making waves with buyers
data.text:
A sampling of films at the Toronto Festival that are making waves with buyers.

Toronto Midnight Madness Selection/World Premiere

Baskin

Director: Can Evrenol

Cast: Gorkem Kasal, Ergun Kuyucu, Mehmet Cerrahoglu, Sabahattin Yakut, Mehmet Fatih Dokgoz, Muharrem Bayrak

Producers: Can Evrenol, Serhat Cinisli, Mehmet Cemal Toz

Synopsis: Turkish police unit discover a blood-soaked den used for satanic rituals in a desolate area.

Sales: Salt Co. (international); XYZ Films (domestic)

TORONTO FESTIVAL SELECTION / WORLD PREMIERE

Born to Dance

Director: Tammy Davis

Producers: Jill MacNab, Leanne Saunders,

Daniel Story

Cast: Tai Maipi,

Stan Walker

Synopsis: A Maori teen in New Zealand faces societal and other pressures when leading his hip-hop dance team to the championships.

Sales: CMG (international)

Colonia

Director:

Florian Gallenberger

Producers: Benjamin Herrmann, Nicolas Steil Cast: Emma Watson,

Daniel Bruehl

Synopsis: A young woman’s search for her kidnapped boyfriend draws her into an infamous sect.

Sales: Beta Cinema (international); UTA (U.S.)

Popular on Variety

February

Director: Osgood Perkins

Producers: Rob Paris, Adrienne Biddle, Bryan Bertino, Robert Menzies, Alphonse Ghossein

Cast: Emma Roberts, Kiernan Shipka

Synopsis: Unseen forces possess girls at prep school.

Sales: Highland Film Group (international); CAA/UTA (U.S.)

The Idol

Director: Hany Abu-Assad

Producers: Ali Jaafar, Amira Diab

Cast: Qais Atallah, Hiba Atallah, Ahmad Qassim, Abdelkarim Abu Baraka, Tawfeek Barhom, Ashraf Barhoum, Ali Suliman, Nadine Labaki

Synopsis: Based on the true story of Mohammad Assaf, winner of “Arab Idol.”

Sales: Seville Intl.

In the Room

Director: Eric Khoo

Producer: Nansun Shi

Cast: Choi Woo Shik, Kim Kkobbi, Koh Boon Pin, Daniel Jenkins, Show Nishino

Synopsis: Drama draws together several narratives spanning several decades, all taking place in the same room of a Singaporean hotel.

Sales: Distribution Workshop

London Fields

Director: Matthew Cullen

Producers: Chris Hanley, Jordan Gertner, Geyer Kosinski

Cast: Amber Heard, Billy Bob Thornton, Jim Sturgess, Theo James

Synopsis: Based on the Martin Amis novel

Sales: IM Global (international); CAA (U.S.)

The Man Who Knew Infinity (above)

Director: Matthew Brown

Producers: Edward R. Pressman, Jim Young, Joe Thomas, Matthew Brown, Sofia Sondervan, Jon Katz

Cast: Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel

Synopsis: Based on the life of Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan.

Sales: Mister Smith Entertainment (international); CAA (domestic)

Semana Santa

Director: Alejandra Marquez Abella

Producers: Nicolas Celis, Sebastian Celis, Andres Clariond

Cast: David Thornton, Tenoch Huerta, Jimena Cuaron

Synopsis: A young widow, her fanatically religious child and her new boyfriend all take a beach vacation during Holy Week to bring the new family together, but the past begins to catch up.

Sales: IM Global (international)

Toronto festival selection/world premiere

Septembers of Shiraz

Director: Wayne Blair

Producers: Hanna Weg, Heidi Jo Markel, Alan Siegel, Gerard Butler, Danielle Robinson, Les Weldon

Cast: Adrien Brody, Salma Hayek, Shohreh Aghdashloo, Alon Aboutboul

Synopsis: A family is thrust into a n unimaginably surreal experience in post-revolutionary Iran.

Sales: Millennium Entertainment (international); Paradigm (U.S.)

The Steps

Director: Andrew Currie

Producers: Mary Anne Waterhouse, Daniel Iron, Andrew Currie, Jason James

Cast: Jason Ritter, Emmanuelle Chriqui, James Brolin, Christine Lahti, Vinay Virmani

Synopsis: An uptight New Yorker and his party -girl sister visit their father and meet his new wife and her kids. When the parents announce they’re adopting a child to bring the family together, it has the opposite effect.

Sales: Seville Intl.

TORONTO FESTIVAL SELECTION / NORTH AMERICAN PREMIERE

Equals

Director: Drake Doremus

Producers: Michael Schaefer, Michael Pruss, Ann Ruark, Chip Diggins, Jay Stern

Cast: Kristen Stewart, Nicholas Hoult, Guy Pearce, Jacki Weaver

Synopsis: Set in the seemingly perfect future in which emotions are eradicated.

Sales: Mister Smith Entertainment (international); UTA (U.S.)

Ithaca

Director: Meg Ryan

Producers: Janet

Brenner, Laura Ivey

Cast: Meg Ryan, Jack Quaid, Sam Shepard, Melanie Griffith, Tom Hanks

Synopsis: Ryan’s directorial debut based on William Saroyan’s “The Human Comedy.”

Sales: The Exchange (international); ICM (domestic)

Looking for Grace

Director: Sue Brooks

Producers: Lizzette Atkins, Sue Taylor, Alison Tilson

Cast: Odessa Young, Radha Mitchell, Richard Roxburgh

Synopsis: Free-spirited 15-year-old girl runs away from home in drama about lies, secrets, grief and love.

Sales: Fortissimo Films (international; U.S.)
